reviewText: ABOUT THIS VHS: A fine quality dub in SP mode and HiFi sound. TURNER's THE INFAMOUS DOROTHY PARKER was originally a TV documentary entitled, "Would You Kindly Direct Me to Hell?: The Infamous Dorothy Parker." This 40 minute exploration includes commentary from some familiar folks, plus clips of a 1994 movie, MRS. PARKER AND THE VICIOUS CIRCLE. (VHS) (DVD) At times the A&E-produced documentary plays like a commercial for that movie. Based on film excerpts alone, one might conclude that the prolific scriptwriter, critic, essayist and member of the Algonquin Roundtable never had a sober day in her life-- certainly there were reasons for such behavior. Dorothy's troubles began in childhood, when she witnessed the deaths of both her mom and stepmother. In the 1920s she was best known as a NEW YORKER magazine contributor and for a caustic and eminently quotable wit. Unhappily married three times, Dottie survived several suicide attempts and did have a drinking problem that worsened with time. After abandoning the roundtable she helped found, Parker became a Hollywood screenwriter. During the '40s she was a frequent guest on various radio shows. Her extreme left wing attitudes got Parker blacklisted in 1950. In later life she scripted an unsuccessful play and wrote book reviews for ESQUIRE. A number of subsequent movie proposals never materialized and her final few years were spent in near-poverty. Dorothy Parker died of a heart attack in 1967 at age 67. An urn filled with her ashes lay unclaimed for 17 years in a file cabinet at a NY attorney's office. As of 5/09, "Infamous Dorothy Parker" was not available on DVD. Related item: Dot Parker is a character in the 1977 film JULIA. Cast includes Jane Fonda, Vanessa Redgrave, Meryl Streep, Jason Robards, Maximillian Schell and Hal Holbrook. (VHS) (DVD) Parenthetical number preceding title is 1 to 10 viewer poll rating found at a film resource website. (5.8) The Infamous Dorothy Parker (TV-1994) - Commentary from: Heywood Hale Broun/Fran Leibowitz/Brendan Gill/Gloria Steinem/Matthew Broderick/Wendy Liebman/Alan Rudolph/Campbell Scott (plus clips of Jennifer Jason Leigh as Dorothy Parker)
